isis.stitle: 10 SPEED TRANSMISSIONS SPICER AUTOMATE-2 - INSTALL - RANGE CASE

step1.para: Install the range countershaft shims (thin ones first) and retainer plates ( Figure 189).
Tighten the bolts to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N· m).

caution.para: Make sure the shims are in line with the plate holes to help ensure proper transmission operation.

step1.para: Check the main box countershaft end play ( Figure 190).

caution.para: Make sure end play is between .003 and .008 inch on each countershaft. This will help ensure proper transmission functioning.

step1.para: Install the countershaft reverse gears ( Figure 191). These gears only fit in one position because of the blind spline. Secure each gear with a washer and bolt. Tighten the bolts to 78 to 98 ft-lbs. (106 to 133 N· m).
Install the reverse gear and thrust plate ( Figure 192).
Lift up slightly on reverse gear, then place the range countershafts in the housing ( Figure 193). Lifting the gear will help center it and the thrust plate once the countershafts are installed.
Install the high range drive gear ( Figure 194). Align the timing marks with those on the countershafts.

figure.caption: Figure 194. Install High Range Drive Gear

step1.para: Install the rear clutch drive gear and the synchronizer cup ( Figure 195). Secure them with the washer and bolt. Tighten to 78 to 98 ft-lbs. (106 to 133 N· m).

Install the synchronizer and fork with the synchronizer springs facing the output yoke or flange ( Figure 196). Make sure the synchronizer springs stay in place during installation. Installation is easiest if the synchronizer is in neutral. Place a new, lubricated O-ring on the fork assembly.
Press the tapered bearing and spacer onto the output shaft ( Figure 197).
Install the output shaft assembly now. Low range gear should be centered between the countershafts.

warning.para: When pressing bearings, use a shield to protect people from possible flying parts.

step1.para: Apply purple Loctite 515 or the equivalent to the housing face, then lower the rear case into place ( Figure 198). Tighten the case bolts to 78 to 98 ft-lbs. (106 to 133 N· m).
Use a suitable driver and rubber mallet to drive the cup, spacer, cup and bearing into the case ( Figure 199). These bearings are part of a matched set.

caution.para: If one of these compo nents is replaced, the entire set must be replaced. This will help ensure proper end play.

step1.para: Install the output bearing cap. To shim the output bearing cap, measure the distance from the end of the case to the bearing cup (A, Figure 200).
Measure from the face of the bearing cap to the end of the pilot (B, Figure 201). Subtract the two figures to determine the amount of shims to provide a tolerance of 0 to .004 inch.
Install the output bearing cap and shims ( Figure 202). Apply purple Loctite 515 or the equivalent to the output bearing cap. Secure it with bolts tightened to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N· m).
Install new O-rings on the piston and in the housing ( Figure 203). Then install the piston. The counterbore on the piston should face the new O-ring on the rod.

figure.caption: Figure 203. New O-Rings On Piston & In Housing

step1.para: Install the retaining nut and tighten to 52 to 62 ft-lbs. (71 to 84 N· m) ( Figure 204). Lubricate the piston O-ring.
Install the range piston housing with the four bolts ( Figure 205). The air inlet should be at the top. Tighten to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N· m).
Apply Loctite 515 or the equivalent to the bearing cap assembly. Install it ( Figure 206).

caution.para: Align the bearing cap oil groove with the case oil port to help ensure proper lubrication.

step1.para: Also align the oil cooler pump drive in the countershaft slot. Tighten bolts to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N· m).

Assemble the two spacers and air regulator on the countershaft bearing cap assembly ( Figure 207). The air regulator bolts are longer than the bearing cap bolts. Apply purple Loctite 515 or the equivalent to the cap and install it onto the case. Tighten the bolts to 34 to 41 ft-lbs. (46 to 56 N· m).
Apply 55 psi of air to the piston fitting until you hear the range section shift into high gear ( Figure 208). Doing this will make it easier to install the unit into a truck.

figure.caption: Figure 208. Apply Air To Piston Fitting

step1.para: Install the end yoke or flange, washer and nut ( Figure 209). Tighten the nut to 550 to 600 ft-lbs. (746 to 813 N· m).
Prepare to install the electric speedometer sensing unit by turning the output shaft until a shaft tooth is centered in the sensor port ( Figure 210).

figure.caption: Figure 210. Shaft Tooth Centered In Sensor Port

step1.para: Install the electronic speed sensor until it just touches an output shaft tooth ( Figure 211). Then back it out 1/2 to 3/4 of a turn. Tighten the locknut to 25 ft-lbs. (34 N· m).
Install the oil cooler pump hose ( Figure 212).
Place the transmission in a horizontal position ( Figure 213).

warning.para: When moving heavy parts, use a chain hoist to help prevent personal injury.

step1.para: Install the two clutch housing retainer bolts. Tighten to 78 to 98 ft-lbs. (106 to 133 N· m).

figure.caption: Figure 213. Install Two Clutch Housing Retainer Bolts
